Package arcade.core.sim

Interface Simulation

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    PatchSimulation, PatchSimulationHex, PatchSimulationRect, PottsSimulation, PottsSimulation2D, PottsSimulation3D
    public interface Simulation
    A Simulation sets up agents and environments for a simulation.

    A Simulation consists of stepping the model for a given random seed. At the start, agents and environments are added the instance and scheduled. Any additional steppables, including actions and components, are also scheduled.

    A Simulation should also extend SimState from the MASON library. SimState manages the actual "stepping" of the model, while the Simulation interface ensures the model can interact with other interfaces and classes in the package.

      • setupAgents

        void setupAgents()
        Sets up the agents in the grid for the simulation.

        The concrete implementing class calls this and other setup methods from the MASON library start() method, which is called before the schedule starts stepping the simulation.

      • setupEnvironment

        void setupEnvironment()
        Sets up the environment using lattices for the simulation.

        The concrete implementing class calls this and other setup methods from the MASON library start() method, which is called before the schedule starts stepping the simulation.
